Description: Part of a gold clasp from a necklace or a bracelet, with a small ring welded to the top of a hemispherical hollow cover, and a small round hole pierced on one side to thread and knot the string.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ?
Curator's comments: Among the gold "foil ornaments" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 19.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 19)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.84, p.186, pl.28)
